* [About »](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/about)
  + About Us
    --------

    Magnolia, Texas is located in southwest Montgomery County, nationally ranked as 7th in growth among U.S. counties.  A short drive from Houston, Magnolia is poised for expansion with the arrival of the SH 249 Toll Way and major corporations like ExxonMobil moving into the area. At the crossroads of progress Magnolia is still a place where neighbors help neighbors—a place to call home or grow your business.

    *[Learn More](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/about)*

Election Information
====================

[![Vote Button](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/sites/g/files/vyhlif7206/f/imce/election-clipart-church-voter-meeting-2_web.png)](https://documentcloud.adobe.com/link/track?uri=urn:aaid:scds:US:ef8777ce-9676-4d3f-bba6-b7e9e186f08f#pageNum=1)

**May 2, 2026 General Election**

[Internet Posting Requirements](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/internet-posting-requirement-may-2026-election)  
Notice / Aviso: [Notice of Deadline to File Place on Ballot 202](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/notice-deadline-file-application-place-ballot-may-2026)6  
Notice / Aviso: [Notice of Drawing for Order of Place on Ballot 2026](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/notice-drawing-order-place-ballot-2026)

The City of Magnolia will hold a General Election on May 2, 2026 for the purpose of electing a Mayor and two (2) Council Members to Position 4 and Position 5 for a two-year term expiring May 2028.

**CANDIDATE PACKET FOR MAY 2026 ELECTION (with bookmarks)****:**[[CLICK HERE]](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/May2026CandidatePacket)

**CURRENT APPLICANTS** (in random order)**:**  
[Jack L Huitt Jr (For Mayor)](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/jack-huitt-candidate-may-2026-election)  
[Todd Kana (For Mayor)](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/todd-kana-candidate-may-2026-election)  
[Chris Blair (For Mayor)](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/chris-blair-candidate-may-2026-election)  
[Raymond K. Gaskin III (For Pos. 5)](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/raymond-k-gaskin-iii-candidate-may-2026-election)

**Election Day**  
Saturday, May 2, 2026 from 7:00 am. to 7:00 pm.

**General Election for Officers**  
Mayor  
Council Position 4  
Council Position 5  
  
2026 - Mayor, Positions 4 and 5  
2027 - Positions 1, 2 and 3  
2028 - Mayor, Positions 4 and 5  
2029 - Position 1, 2 and 3

**Early Voting:**  
April 20-25   Monday-Saturday   8am-5pm  
April 27-28   Monday-Tuesday    7am-7pm

**Early Voting Locations:** [[Link]](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/earling-voting-polling-locations-and-times)  
  
**Election Day Voting Locations:** [[Link]](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/election-day-voting-locations)  
  
**Qualifications for Candidacy/Holding Office:**

* Each member of the City Council, including the Mayor shall meet the following qualifications:
* Must be a citizen of the United States
* Must be a qualified, registered voter of the City of Magnolia;
* Mayor: Must be a resident of Texas for twelve (12) months and the City of Magnolia for at least twelve (12) months prior to the date of filing. Council: Must be a resident of Texas for twelve (12) months and the City of Magnolia for at least six (6) months prior to the date of filing.
* Must continue residency in the City during the term of office;
* Not hold more than one elective office;
* Must not hold an appointed office of the City excluding boards, committees and commissions;
* Must be 18 years of age or older at the commencement of the term to be filled by election;
* Must not have been determined mentally incompetent by a final judgment in court; and
* Must not have been finally convicted of a felony from which the person has not been pardoned or otherwise released from the resulting disabilities or had Civil rights restored by other official action.

**Applications for ballot by mail shall be mailed to:**  
Suzie Harvey, Elections Administrator, P.O. Box 2646, Conroe, TX 77305-2646  
Contact Info - Email: [election.ballot@mctx.org](mailto:election.ballot@mctx.org)    Fax: (936) 788-8340  
  
Applications for Ballot by Mail may be obtained by calling (936) 539-7843.  
Applications for ballots by mail must be received by the Early Voting Clerk NO later than the close of business day on Tuesday, April 23, 2024.

In accordance with the Texas Election Code, the City Secretary serves as the Chief Election Official for the City of Magnolia and is tasked with overseeing and administering all City elections.

Please check back regularly for updated information regarding local elections.

---

**May 3, 2025 General Election  
[FINAL CANVASS REPORT FOR MAY 2025 ELECTION](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/election-final-canvass-report-may-2025)**  
[Election Ordinance No. O-2025-013](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/ordinance-no-o-2025-013)

**CURRENT APPLICANTS (in ballot order - [drawing results here](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/results-order-names-ballot-2025)):**  
POSITION 1: [Daniel Miller](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/daniel-miller-2025-election-candidate)  
POSITION 1: [Caleb Small](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/caleb-small-2025-election-candidate)  
POSITION 2: [Todd Kana](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/todd-kana-2025-election-candidate)  
POSITION 2: [Buck Perino](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/buck-perino-2025-election-candidate)  
POSITION 3: [Geoff Beyer](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/geoff-beyer-2025-election-candidate)  
POSITION 3: [Richard Carby](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/richard-carby-2025-election-candidate)

**Main Election Day Voting Locations:**[**Link**](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/election-day-voting-locations-may-2025-election)  
  
**Early Voting**  
April 22-26, 2025   Tuesday - Saturday   8:00am-5:00pm  
April 28-29, 2025   Monday - Tuesday    7:00am-7:00pm

**Early Voting Locations:**[**Link**](https://www.cityofmagnolia.com/home/files/early-voting-locations-may-2025-election)
